description: Episode of Series "Four corners (Television program)". Discusses the devleopment and increasing use of computers in Australia. Banks, the TAB, the stock exchange, aviation companies and many government social service departments are extensively computerised. Computers have an invaluable application in medical research and hospital services, and road traffic control. Presents the problem of redundant workers in a computerised community and questions the morality of a National Data Bank.
